findings.title: Hardcoded API Key in Source Code
findings.description: API keys and secrets found directly in source code files, exposing sensitive credentials
findings.recommendation: Move all API keys to environment variables and use a secrets management system

findings.title: SQL Injection Vulnerability
findings.description: User input is directly concatenated into SQL queries without proper sanitization
findings.recommendation: Use parameterized queries or prepared statements for all database operations

findings.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability
findings.description: User-controlled data is rendered without proper escaping
findings.recommendation: Implement proper input validation and output encoding

findings.title: Weak Password Policy
findings.description: Password requirements do not meet security best practices
findings.recommendation: Enforce stronger password requirements (minimum 12 characters, mixed case, numbers, symbols)

findings.title: Session Timeout Not Configured
findings.description: User sessions do not expire, allowing indefinite access
findings.recommendation: Implement session timeout with a maximum duration of 30 minutes of inactivity

findings.title: Sensitive Data in Logs
findings.description: User passwords and tokens are being logged in application logs
findings.recommendation: Sanitize all logs to remove sensitive information before writing

findings.title: HTTPS Not Enforced
findings.description: Application allows HTTP connections alongside HTTPS
findings.recommendation: Redirect all HTTP traffic to HTTPS and implement HSTS headers

findings.title: Outdated Dependencies
findings.description: Several npm packages have known vulnerabilities
findings.recommendation: Run 'npm audit fix' and update to latest stable versions

priority_recommendations.rationale: Exposed API keys can lead to unauthorized access and data breaches
SQL injection can lead to complete database compromise
XSS vulnerabilities can steal user sessions and sensitive data
